definitions: A substance, typically an inorganic oxide, that combines with a dye or stain and thereby fixes it in a material.
An adhesive used in gilding to fix gold leaf to a surface.
An acid or other corrosive substance used in etching to bite into the surface of a metal plate.
examples: The dyer added a chrome mordant to the wool.
Apply the mordant before laying the gold leaf.
The acid acted as a mordant on the copper plate.
